sentences.text: ITEM  OF BUSINESS NO. 2  RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF OUR INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THIS SECTION SHOULD BE READ IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE " A U D IT COM M ITTEE REPORT"
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm retained to audit the  Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this oversight, the Audit Committee considers the firms independence, qualifications, performance, and whether the independent  registered public accounting firm should be rotated, as well as the impact of such a rotation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche LLP ("D&T") has been retained as our independent registered public  accounting firm since fiscal 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley requirements, the Lead Audit Partner from D&T rotates off our account every five years, with oversight in  selection by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The last Lead Audit Partner rotation occurred in March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee appointed D&T as our independent registered public  accounting firm for the fiscal year ending February 3, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will ask shareholders to ratify the appointment of D&T as our independent registered public accounting firm at the  Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of D&T are expected to attend the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will have the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and are expected to be available to  respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Accountant Services and Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for the audit fee negotiations associated with the retention of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the fiscal years ended  January 28, 2017, and January 30, 2016, D&T served as our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table presents the aggregate fees incurred for services  rendered by D&T during fiscal 2017 and fiscal 2016, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fees listed below were pre-approved by our Audit Committee pursuant to the Audit Committee's pre-approval  policy as described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Service Type  Fiscal 2017  Fiscal 2016 Audit Fees'"  $  2,515,000 $  2,740,000 Audit-Related Fees'2    375,000  400,000 Tax Fees'3      50,000 Total Fees  $  2,890,000 $  3,190,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  Consists of fees for professional services rendered in connection with the audits of our consolidated financial statements and the effectiveness of  our internal control over financial reporting for the  fiscal years January 28, 2017, and January 30, 2016; the reviews of the consolidated financial statements included in each of our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q during those  fiscal years; and consultations on accounting matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)  Consists primarily of fees for statutory audit filings, as well as the audits of our retirement savings plans and foundations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)  Consists primarily of tax compliance services based on time and materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy that our independent registered public accounting firm be engaged to provide primarily audit and audit-related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, pursuant to the policy, in certain  circumstances and using stringent standards in its evaluation, the Audit Committee may authorize our independent registered public accounting firm to provide tax services when it  determines that D&T is the most efficient and effective tax service provider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with SEC rules regarding auditor independence, the Audit Committee is responsible for appointing, setting fees for and overseeing the work of our independent  registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recognition of this responsibility and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, it is the policy of the Audit  Committee to pre-approve all permissible services provided by our independent registered public accounting firm, except for minor audit-related engagements which in the  aggregate do not exceed 5% of the fees we pay to our independent registered public accounting firm during a fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, prior to engaging our independent registered public accounting firm, management submits to the Audit Committee for approval a list of services expected to be provided during that fiscal year within each of the three categories of services described below, as well as related estimated fees, which are generally based on time and materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit services include audit work performed on the financial statements, as well as work that generally only the independent registered public accounting firm can reasonably be  expected to provide, including comfort letters and discussions surrounding the proper application of financial accounting and/or reporting standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Document
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-related services include assurance and related services that are traditionally performed by the independent registered public accounting firm, including due diligence related to mergers and acquisitions, statutory audits, employee benefit plan audits and special procedures required to meet certain regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax services include compliance and other non-advisory services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm when it is most efficient and effective to use such  firm as the tax service provider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As appropriate, the Audit Committee then pre-approves the services and the related estimated fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee requires our independent registered public accounting firm and management to report actual fees versus the estimate periodically throughout the year by category of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, circumstances may arise when it becomes  necessary to engage our independent registered public accounting firm for additional services not contemplated in the initial annual proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In those instances, the Audit  Committee pre-approves the additional services and related fees before engaging our independent registered public accounting firm to provide the additional services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Voting Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Audit Committee and the Board believe that the continued retention of D&T to serve as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm is in the  best interests of the Company and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that shareholders vote FOR the proposal to ratify the appointment of D&T as our independent  registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending February 3, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the voting power of the shares present and entitled to vote at the Meeting is required to ratify D&T as our independent registered accounting  firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although ratification is not required pursuant to our By-laws or otherwise, the Board is submitting the selection of D&T to our shareholders for ratification because we value our  shareholders' views on the Company's independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the appointment of D&T were not to be ratified by the shareholders, the Audit Committee  would not be required to appoint another independent registered public accounting firm, but would give consideration to an unfavorable vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the  Audit Committee, in its discretion, may select a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in  the best interests of the Company and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, we continued to make progress in our transformation journey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It marked the second year in a row that we increased our domestic revenue and expanded our operating  margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We saw a continued improvement in customer satisfaction as our Net Promoter Score (including both purchasers and non-purchasers) improved by more than 300 basis  points and we grew online revenue 13% to more than $4 billion, or 11% of total domestic revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also delivered $150 million against our $400 million cost reduction and gross  profit optimization efforts, which was in addition to the $1 billion in costs we already removed from our business since fiscal 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following our fiscal 2016 performance, the Compensation Committee made few adjustments to the NEO compensation for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of the changes is included  below and explained in further detail within our C o m p e n s a tio n  D is c u s s io n  a n d  A n a ly s is :
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B a s e  S a la r ie s : We made base salary changes for Ms. Barry and Mr. Mohan in recognition of Ms. Barry's appointment as Chief Financial Officer and changes to the scop of Mr. Mohan's responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S h o rt-T e rm  In c e n tiv e s : There were no material changes to the short-term incentive targets for the NEOs, with the exception of Ms. Barry upon her appointment as Chief  Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Renew Blue Priority financial metrics for the short-term incentive program were slightly modified to include an additional metric related to Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the weighting of the short-term incentive metrics shifted to place an increased weight on Domestic comparable sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: L o n g -T e r m  In c e n tiv e s : Our long-term incentive program changes included increased targets for Ms. Barry and Mr. Mohan in light of their increasing responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Compensation Committee also approved the addition of a performance component to the time-based restricted share portion of the long-term incentive awards for NEOs in order to further promote alignment between pay and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: O th e r  C o m p e n s a tio n : The NEOs continue to receive the same employee benefits, perquisites and other rewards offered to our U.S.-based officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide  special pension benefits or other non-performance-based entitlements to the NEOs that are inconsistent with our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: P r e v ie w  o f   K e y  F is c a l 2 0 1 8  C o m p e n s a tio n  D e c is io n s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past year, we continued to make focused and well-executed moves consistent with our objectives, resulting in delivery of topline performance in line with our goals and  materially better earnings growth than originally expected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fiscal 2017 revenue was $39.4 billion, with an increase in non-GAAP operating income rate from 4% to 4.5% and  growth of non-GAAP diluted EPS from continuing operations by 28% from $2.78 to $3.56.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also increased our Net Promoter Score by over 350 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From a multi channel perspective, we grew the Domestic segment online revenue with comparable sales of 20.8% in fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our international market, the successful Canadian brand  consolidation was the primary driver of operating income of $90 million in our International segment for fiscal 2017 compared to a loss of $210 million in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To meet our  goal of driving cost reduction and efficiencies, we made continued progress against our three-year target to reduce cost and optimize gross profit by $400 million and achieved $350  million cumulative savings by the end of fiscal 2017; these savings enabled us to invest in customer experience improvements while maintaining near flat SG&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy, Objectives and Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation philosophy is to align executive compensation with shareholders  interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the Compensation Committee works to ensure that base salaries are market competitive, and short- and long-term incentives are heavily weighted toward Company performance and are within the range of market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: e achieve these objectives by using programs that are designed to align employee interests with Company goals and create a common vision of success without undue risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior years, we utilized the following executive compensation policies and practices during fiscal 2017:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: P a y -fo r -p e r fo r m a n c e .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We tie pay to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of executive pay is not guaranteed but instead is tied to performance metrics designed to drive shareholde value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If performance goals are not attained, no incentive compensation is paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M itig a te  u n d u e  risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We mitigate undue risk by, among other things, utilizing caps on incentive award payments and vesting periods on potential equity payments,  clawback provisions, restrictive covenants and multiple performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually reviews our compensation risk profile to ensure that  our compensation-related risks are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I n d e p e n d e n t C o m p e n s a tio n  C o m m itte e  a n d  C o m m itte e  C o n su lta n t.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is comprised solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee's independent compensation consultant is retained directly by the Compensation Committee and performs no other consulting or other services for the  Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S h a r e h o ld e r  e n g a g e m e n t.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We routinely engage with shareholders regarding executive compensation and related issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: R e -p r ic in g  o f   s to c k  o p tio n s.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options may not, without the approval of our shareholders, be
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) amended to reduce their initial exercise price (except for adjustments in the case of a stock split or similar event);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) canceled and replaced by stock options having a lower exercise price; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) canceled and replaced with cash or other  securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: S to c k  o w n e r s h ip  a n d  tr a d in g  p o lic ie s .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have stock ownership guidelines for all of our executive officers and Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the end of fiscal 2017, each NEO  and director was in compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit all employees, including the NEOs and members of the Board, from hedging Company securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers and Board members are also prohibited from pledging Company securities as collateral for a loan or from holding Company securities in a margin  account.

sentences.text: Our executive officers, including the NEOs, generally receive the same employee benefits as other officers.

sentences.text: We do not have an executive retirement plan that provides extra benefits to the NEOs.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the roles of each of the key participants in the executive compensation decision-making process for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Participant Compensation Committee Role in Decision-Making Process  Establishes our compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determines, approves and oversees executive compensation, including the design, competitiveness and effectiveness of our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also oversees the  development, evaluation and approval of incentive compensation, equity-based pay and other material employee benefit plans for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee  may delegate its responsibility to oversee compensation employees other than for the NEOs or other Section 16 officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's charter is available on our website at www.investors.bestbuy.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews the recommendations of management with the Compensation Committee to ensure that the recommendations are aligned with our objectives and are reasonable when  compared to our market for executive and director talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assists the Compensation Committee in the design of the variable incentive plans, the determination of the overall compensation mix, the selection of performance metrics and  the setting of the performance goals and ranges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides analysis and crafts recommendations for the Compensation Committee in the setting of CEO compensation opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviews the results of the compensation risk assessment with the Compensation Committee and identifies key takeaways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides perspective on market practice and information about emerging trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has sole discretion and adequate funding to engage consultants in connection with compensation-related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. ha served as the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant since the fall of 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Creates and presents recommendations to the Compensation Committee for our other executive officers and provides his perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Does not participate in, or otherwise  influence, recommendations regarding his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides the Compensation Committee with market analytics in support of the CEO's recommendations for our executive officers, other than the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management does not  make recommendations on CEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As necessary, HR engages outside consultants to assist with its analytics and recommendations.

sentences.text: Market Competitive Data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, each element of compensation and the level of total direct compensation for our NEOs was considered against market benchmarks and  views of individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee reviewed publicly available compensation data for our peer group of companies, Fortune 100 companies and  general industry survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We used available information and monitored actions taken by our peer group to evaluate market trends and to assess the long-term incentive program and overall competitiveness of our executive compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not, however, seek to establish any specific element of compensation or total direct compensation that  falls within a prescribed range relative to our peer group of companies or the Fortune 100 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Peer Group  for Fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review our peer group annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee strives to ensure that our peer group is an accurate reflection of our  business model, represents the labor market for executive talent and includes external perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, the peer group was approved after consideration of the following  criteria:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business model: combination of physical retailers, e-commerce retailers, digital companies, global companies and iconic brands;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Size: revenue similar to ours;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current peers: preference, but not obligation, toward consistency in an effort to maintain reliability from year to year in the results of our compensation analysis; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Labor market consideration: companies that listed us as a peer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the Companys position relative to the peer group on the basis of earnings, revenue and market cap, and made no changes to our peer  group for fiscal 2017 from fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs are designed to ensure that a significant percentage of total compensation is linked to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, the NEOs were  eligible for performance-based, short-term incentive cash awards pursuant to our fiscal 2017 STI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fiscal 2017 STI is structured as a plan within a plan, pursuant to the 2014 shareholder-approved Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014 Omnibus Incentive Plan sets the  maximum award pool for the CEO and three other NEOs (excluding the CFO) at 5% of adjusted net earnings to align compensation with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual  allocations of that pool are set annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific performance goals are established such that the maximum payout potential does not exceed the maximum award pool or the  individual allocations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2017 STI Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2016, the Compensation Committee approved the performance criteria for the fiscal 2017 STI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, the Compensation  Committee approved generally the same performance metrics as in fiscal 2016, with some refinement of the Renew Blue Priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating income, comparable sales, U.S. online  revenue growth, and customer experience remained in the mix, and Services Productive Revenue was added as a metric due to the increasing importance of our services business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The weighting of the priorities changed to placing the greatest emphasis on profit, while also giving significant weight to Domestic comparable sales and our fiscal 2017 Renew  Blue strategic priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial metrics for fiscal 2017 were: Enterprise operating income, Domestic comparable sales, U.S. waste and efficiency, U.S. online revenue growth, U.S. net promoter score  and U.S. services productive revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI Metric Metric Weighting Definition Compensable Enterprise Operating Income 40%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Served as the minimum  threshold for STI awards to be paid Enterprise revenue less Enterprise cost of goods sold less Enterprise SG&A expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Domestic Comparable Sales 30% Domestic revenue at websites, stores, and call centers operating for at least 14 full months,  compared to revenue from similar channels open at least 14 full months in the prior fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Renew Blue Priorities: U.S. Waste and Efficiency 7.5% Annualized net year-over-year cost savings (gross savings less reinvestment, compared to fiscal  2016 expense) of cost reduction actions put into effect in fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Online Revenue Growth 7.5% Total fiscal 2017 online revenue less total fiscal 2016 online revenue divided by total fiscal 2016  online revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Net Promoter Score 7.5% Customer experience metric in which customers (both purchasers and non-purchasers) are asked  how likely they are to recommend Best Buy to a friend, colleague or family member; the percent  of those likely to recommend less the percent of those unlikely to recommend is Net Promoter  Score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Services Productive Revenue 7.5% Focus on the overall growth of Services inclusive of the recurring sales of services as measured  by productive revenue, which includes sales of warranty, tech support, services and installation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the Compensation Committee approved the performance goals for each metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum, target and maximum goals for each metric were evaluated in order to  ensure they would incent the desired level of performance for each priority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For some metrics, this evaluation resulted in changes to the minimum, target, and maximum goals in  light of anticipated year-over-year industry trends, product cycles, and other market factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart shows actual fiscal 2017 performance compared to the minimum, target and maximum goals for each metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 'Minimum' performance against the goal results in  a 0.00 payout, 'Target' performance results in a 1.00 payout, and 'Maximum' performance results in a 2.00 payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final metric score is interpolated as an exact point somewhere  between 0.00 and 2.00.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of  Fiscal 2017 STI Target Payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed the target payout percentages for our NEOs under the fiscal 2017 STI plan as part of their review of the NEOs  total fiscal 2017 target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally applies a tiered approach in determining the potential target payout ranging  from 100% to 200% of annual earnings based on each NEO's eligible earnings as of the 15th  day of each fiscal month.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific target payout percentage for each NEO is  determined based on external market data (including survey and proxy data from the Fortune 100 and our peer group) for equivalent roles, with emphasis placed on job value and  internal pay equity among the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2017, the tiered target opportunities were 100% to 200% of salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target payout percentages for each NEO remained the same as in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each of the  metrics, the NEOs could earn zero to two or three times their weighted target payout percentage for that metric (e.g. the U.S. Waste & Efficiency metric has a three times  opportunity), but the maximum fiscal 2017 STI payout was capped at two times their target payout percentage.

sentences.text: Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a severance plan that complies with the applicable provisions of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act ("ERISA).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the severance  plan is to provide financial assistance to employees while they seek other employment, in exchange for a release of any claims.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although there are differences in benefits depending  on the employee's job level, the basic elements of the plan are comparable for all eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan generally covers all full-time and part-time U.S. employees of Best  Buy Co., Inc. and Best Buy Stores, L.R and their respective direct and indirect U.S.-domiciled subsidiaries, including the NEOs, except for those subject to a separate severance  agreement or specifically excluded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan covers involuntary terminations due to job elimination and discontinuation, office closing, reduction in force, business restructuring and other circumstances as we  determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible terminated employees receive a severance payment based on their role and time with the company, with basic employee benefits such as medical, dental and life  nsurance continued for an equivalent period.

sentences.text: Stock Ownership, Tax and Other Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has established stock ownership guidelines to promote the alignment of officer and shareholder interests and  to encourage behaviors that have a positive influence on stock price appreciation and total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the guidelines, we expect our NEOs to acquire ownership of a  fixed number of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shares, based on their positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership expectation generally remains effective for as long as the officer holds the position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to shares personally owned by each officer, the following forms of stock ownership count toward the ownership target:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equivalent shares owned in the Best Buy Stock Fund within our Retirement Savings Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 100% of non-vested shares subject to time-based conditions granted under our LTI program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the intrinsic value of vested stock options (denominated as a number of shares) granted under our LTI program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require that until the ownership target is met, NEOs will retain:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 50% of the net proceeds received from the exercise of a stock option in the form of Best Buy common stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 50% of vested time-based restricted shares (net of taxes); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 50% of all performance share awards (net of taxes) issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ownership target does not need to be met  within a certain time frame, and our NEOs are considered in compliance with the guidelines as long as progress towards the ownership target is being made consistent with the  expectations noted above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2017, all NEOs were in compliance with the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of   Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code ("Section 162(m)M ) limits the deductibility of compensation in excess of $1 million paid to the  chief executive officer and each of our three most highly compensated executive officers (other than the chief financial officer), unless the compensation qualifies as "performance-  based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: " Among other things, in order to be deemed performance-based compensation, the compensation must be based on the achievement of pre-established,  objective performance criteria and must be pursuant to a plan that has been approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is important to continue to be able to take available  Company tax deductions with respect to the compensation paid to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not, however, make compensation decisions based solely on the availability of a deduction  under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback and Restrictive Covenant Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior management performance awards have typically included clawback provisions, particularly where it has been difficult to  match the period of an employee's influence on business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may exercise our rights under such provisions if other strategies to mitigate unjust rewards are difficult to  achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2010, we adopted new guidelines with respect to clawback provisions to comply with the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, with  final clawback language to be determined after the SEC adopts related rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the clawback provisions, we include confidentiality, non-compete, non-solicitation and,  in select situations, non-disparagement provisions in our long-term incentive award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on Hedzinz and Pledging Company Securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit all employees, including NEOs, and members of the Board from hedging Company securities, including by  way of forward contracts, equity swaps, collars, exchange funds or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our executive officers and Board members are prohibited from holding Company  securities in a margin account or pledging Company securities as collateral for a loan.

sentences.text: The table below summarizes the total compensation earned by each of our NEOs during fiscal 2017 and the two preceding fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  These amounts reflect actual earnings based on a blend of prior annual base salary rates and the go-forward base salary rates approved by the Compensation Committee during its annual review in March of each year, as  well as any off-cycle increases approved by the Compensation Committee during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, these amounts are before any deferrals under the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide guaranteed, above market or preferential earnings on compensation deferred under the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment options available for notional investment of deferred compensation are similar to those available under  the Retirement Savings Plan and can be found, along with additional information about deferred amounts, in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)  These amounts reflect the aggregate grant date fair value for stock-based awards granted to our NEOs for all fiscal years reflected, however fiscal 2017 amounts are explained in greater detail under the heading Grants of  Plan-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date fair value reflected for any award subject to performance conditions is the value at the grant date of the probable outcome of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date fair value of an award is  measured in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification Topic 718, Compensation - Stock Compensation ("ASC Topic 718").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts reported have not been adjusted  to eliminate service-based forfeiture assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other assumptions used in calculating these amounts are set forth in Note 7, Shareholders' Equity, to the consolidated financial statements included in our Annual  Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended January 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)  The fiscal 2017 amounts reflected in this column include the probable grant date fair value of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) one or more restricted share awards that vest on a time-based schedule subject to achievement of positive adjusted net  earnings in any fiscal year during the three-year term of the award (described in greater detail in the Grants of  Plan-Based Awards section) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) one or more performance share awards that will be earned depending on  the performance of our stock's total shareholder return, relative to a peer group comprised of the S&P 500 Index, over a three-year period (also described in greater detail in the Grants of  Plan-Based Awards section).

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's Deferred Compensation Plan is unfunded and unsecured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the plan provides a tax-deferred retirement savings vehicle that plays an important role in attracting and retaining executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plan allows highly compensated employees, including the NEOs, to defer:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Up to 75% of base salary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Up to 100% of a cash bonus (earned and paid in the same year) and short-term incentive compensation (earned and paid in different years), as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred under and contributed to the Deferred Compensation Plan are credited or charged with the performance of investment options selected by the participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  investment options are notional and do not represent actual investments, but rather serve as a measurement of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The options available under the Deferred Compensation  Plan and their one-year annualized average rates of return as of the end of fiscal 2017, were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investment Rate of Return^ NVIT Money Market 0.04% PIMCO VIT Total Return 2.34% PIMCO VIT High-Yield Bond 14.27% Fidelity VIP II Asset Manager 9.97% Vanguard VIF Diversified Value 18.72% Vanguard VIF Equity Index 19.86% MFS VIT Growth Series 12.22% Franklin VIPT Small Cap Value Securities 36.52% Vanguard VIF Small Company Growth % Vanguard VIF International 18.64%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  Rate of return is net of investment management fees, fund expenses or administrative charges, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who elect to defer compensation under the Deferred Compensation Plan also select when the deferred amounts will be distributed to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions may be made in  a specific year, or at a specified time that begins on or after the participant's retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions are paid in a lump sum or in quarterly installments, depending on the  participant's election at the time of deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if a participant's employment ends prior to retirement, a distribution is made promptly in a lump sum or in quarterly  installments, depending on their initial election and account balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide employer-matching contributions for amounts deferred under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are fully vested in their contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restrictive Covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As further described in Compensation Discussion and Analysis -  Executive Compensation Elements -  Other Compensation -  Clawback and Restrictive  Covenant Provisions, our executive officer separation agreements and long-term incentive award agreements generally include confidentiality, non-compete, non-solicitation and, in  select situations, non-disparagement provisions as generally described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Confidentiality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award recipients agree to maintain the confidentiality of Best Buys confidential information and to use such information for the exclusive benefit of Best  Buy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This obligation has the appropriate application to the post-termination period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Compete.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award recipients agree not to engage in competitive activity for a period of one year following the earlier of termination of employment for any reason, or th last scheduled award vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award recipients agree not to solicit Company employees for employment or parties with which we do business from engaging such business for a period o one year following the earlier of termination of employment for any reason, or the last scheduled award vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Disparagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-disparagement provision is included in specific circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon violation of a restrictive covenant, unexercised options and unvested shares related to the respective award agreement under which they were issued are canceled and  forfeited, and likewise, the related issued shares (or their fair market value, as measured on the option exercise date or share vesting date) must be returned to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Company may seek injunctive or other appropriate equitable relief.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee reviews the total compensation paid to non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the review is to ensure that the level of compensation is  appropriate to attract and retain a diverse group of directors with the breadth of experience necessary to perform the Board's duties, and to fairly compensate directors for their  service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of their analysis, the Compensation Committee considers the total value of the compensation as compared with director compensation at other Fortune 100  companies and our peer group of companies, which is described in C o m p e n s a tio n  D is c u s s io n  a n d  A n a ly s is  F a c to r s  in D e c is io n -M a k in g .
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the Compensation  Committee reviewed and approved the fiscal 2017 compensation structure for non-management directors, as detailed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, the Board reviewed and approved their  fiscal 2017 compensation based on the Compensation Committee's recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fiscal 2017 cash compensation for our non-management directors consisted of the following annual retainers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Amount Annual retainer $ 85,000 Fead independent director stipend 25,000 Annual committee chair retainer - Audit 25,000 Annual committee chair retainer - Compensation & Human Resources 20,000 Annual committee chair retainer - Nominating 15,000 Annual committee chair retainer - Finance and Investment Policy 10,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All annual retainers for non-management directors who serve on the Board or as chair of a committee for only a portion of a fiscal year are prorated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All annual retainers are paid in  quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 13, 2016, the Compensation Committee approved an annual equity award with a value of $190,000 for all of the then-serving non-management directors (6,514 restricted  stock units) pending approval by the Board, which occurred on June 14, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All restricted stock units granted to our directors fully vest one year from the date of grant and must  be held until the director leaves the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director equity awards are prorated through a directors termination date if a director leaves the Board before the restricted stock units  have vested, unless the director is terminated for Cause, in which case all unvested restricted stock units are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers prorated annual equity awards for new directors who are appointed to the Board between each annual grant in June.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the  Compensation Committee approved a prorated equity award for new director Claudia F. Munce (1,383 restricted stock units) in March 2016 when she joined the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has established stock ownership guidelines requiring our non-management directors to own, indirectly or directly, 10,000 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, we  have expected that, until the ownership target is met, directors would retain 50% of their granted equity (net of taxes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In further support of director stock ownership, we began in  fiscal 2014 granting director equity subject to a holding requirement for the duration of a director's service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2017, all of our non-management directors were in  compliance with the ownership guidelines, either by meeting the ownership target or by making progress towards the ownership target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines for  executive officers are discussed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Executive Compensation Elements  Other Compensation section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D eferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each calendar year, we offer our directors the opportunity to defer up to 100% of their annual and committee chair retainers under the Deferred Compensation Plan which is  described in the section Compensation of  Executive Officers  Nonqualified Deferred Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Company contributions or matching contributions are made for the benefit  of directors under the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse all directors for travel and other necessary business expenses incurred in performance of their services for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all directors are covered under a directors'  and officers' indemnity insurance policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM OF BUSINESS NO. 3  ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), we  are providing our shareholders with an opportunity to cast an advisory vote, a "Say on Pay," regarding our fiscal 2017 executive compensation program, as described in the  Executive and Director Compensation section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes, recommends and governs all of the compensation and benefits policies and actions for the Company's NEOs, as defined in the  Introduction to the Executive and Director Compensation  Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the advisory vote to approve our the  compensation of our named executive officers is not binding on us, it will provide useful information to our Board and the Compensation Committee regarding our shareholders'  views of our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee values our shareholders' opinions and will take the results of the vote into  consideration when determining the future compensation arrangements for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent there are significant negative "Say on Pay" advisory votes, we plan to consult  directly with shareholders to better understand the concerns that influenced the vote and consider constructive feedback in making future decisions about our executive  compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As detailed in our CD&A, we believe our fiscal 2017 executive compensation program reflects market appropriate practices and balances risk and reward in relation to our overall  business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is focused on pay-for-performance and seeks to mitigate risks related to compensation in order to further align  management's interests with shareholders' interests in long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we ask that our shareholders cast an advisory vote to approve the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of the Company approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers for the fiscal year ended January 28,  2017, as described in the Executive and Director Compensation  Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and the compensation tables and related material  disclosed in the Company's proxy statement for its 2017 Regular Meeting of Shareholders pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange  Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Voting Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends an advisory vote FOR approval of the fiscal 2017 compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to the SEC's compensation  disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of at least a majority of the voting power of the shares present, in person or by proxy, and entitled to vote (excluding broker non-votes) is required for advisory approval of our NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IT IS INTENDED THAT, UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED, THE SHARES REPRESENTED BY PROXY (OTHER THAN BROKER NON-VOTES) WILL BE  VOTED 'FOR ' THE ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Document
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM OF BUSINESS NO. 4  ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF HOLDING THE SHAREHOLDER ADVISORY VOTE TO  APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and Section 14A of the Exchange Act also require that at least once every six years, shareholders may vote on  whether the advisory Say on Pay vote should occur every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the  Exchange Act, we are giving our shareholders the opportunity to inform us as to how often they wish to cast an advisory Say on Pay vote, like Item of Business No. 3, above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Holding the Shareholder Advisory Vote on our Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When this Say on Pay frequency vote was last held in June 2011, shareholders indicated to us that they wished to vote every year to approve our executive compensation program  for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In consideration of this feedback, the Board determined to hold such votes on an annual basis until the next vote on the frequency of M Say on Pay   votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we recognize that there are benefits to holding this advisory vote to approve executive compensation less frequently, the Board understands that an annual advisory vote  continues to be the standard most shareholders prefer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation, the Board will continue to solicit and consider  shareholder feedback in regards to our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is appropriate for the  Company and our shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Voting Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes an advisory Say on Pay vote every year (also called a annual vote) will continue to be the most effective means for the Board to receive timely shareholder feedback on our executive compensation and respond to such a vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board recommends that the shareholders vote to hold the advisory Say on Pay vote EVERY  year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shareholders adopt the Boards recommendation, we would hold the next Say on Pay advisory vote at our 2018 Regular Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Note, however, that  shareholders are not voting on whether to approve or disapprove the Boards recommendation, rather shareholders are being asked to affirmatively select the option to cast an  advisory Say on Pay vote every year, every two years or every three years, or to abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We plan to treat the option, if any, selected by the affirmative vote of at least a majority  of the voting power of the shares present, in person or by proxy, and entitled to vote (excluding broker non-votes) as the non-binding option approved by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  Board intends to carefully consider the advisory, non-binding shareholder vote on this proposal when making its determination on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IT IS INTENDED THAT, UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED, THE SHARES REPRESENTED BY PROXY (OTHER THAN BROKER NON-VOTES) WILL BE  VOTED TO HOLD THE ADVISORY SAY ON PAY VOTE EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM OF BUSINESS NO. 5 - APPROVAL OF THE AMENDED AND RESTATED BEST BUY CO., INC. 2014 OMNIBUS INCENTIVE  PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: G e n e r a l In fo r m a tio n  a b o u t th e  P la n  a n d  P r o p o s e d  A m e n d m e n ts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Best Buy Co., Inc. 2014 Omnibus Incentive Plan (the "2014 Plan") was adopted by the Board of Directors in April 2014 and approved by our shareholders in June 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Th 2014 Plan is the means by which we provide long-term incentives to a broad range of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014 Plan permits the granting of stock options, stock appreciation rights ("SARs"), restricted stock and restricted stock units, performance awards, and other stock grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible recipients under the 2014 Plan include any employee, officer, consultant, advisor, or director providing services to us or to any of our affiliates, who is selected by the  Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014 Plan is the only plan by which we issue shares of our common stock as a means of incentive-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, the aggregate number of shares of our  common stock that may be issued under all stock-based awards made under the 2014 Plan is 22.5 million (representing the original amount authorized in 2014).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 31, 2017, approximately 8.8 million shares remained available for awards in the aggregate under the 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From the adoption of the 2014 Plan through the end of fiscal 2017, we have granted equity awards, that, on an annual basis, equate to 2.23% to 3.02% of our outstanding common stock, or 7.5 to 8.8 million shares per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of our awards are restricted- or performance-share awards, which are considered "full value" awards, and use up two shares from the number of shares available for every single  restricted or performance share granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are requesting shareholder approval of a 10.2 million share increase in the number of shares of common stock available under the 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the 2014 Plan was adopted,  we anticipated the need to return to shareholders in 2016 or 2017 to request additional shares under the 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are now looking to fulfill that need and anticipate that, if  approved, the 19 million shares remaining available under the 2014 Plan (i.e. the 8.8 million shares currently available plus 10.2 million requested shares) will meet our needs for  approximately two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares used per year under the 2014 Plan since it was adopted has varied depending on stock price, forfeitures, turnover, and the number of  one-off grants awarded to recruit and retain talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are looking to replenish our shares this year to ensure we can maintain our long-term incentive program as we pursue our Best Buy 2020 growth strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance-  based restricted share grants are designed to motivate our leaders to achieve specific business goals in line with our strategy, and other new hire, retention or recognition awards are  critical to our ability to recruit and retain key individuals in support of this strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the importance of our equity-based incentive programs to achieving the goals of Best  Buy 2020, we believe that our request for additional shares under the 2014 Plan is critical to our long-term performance and shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 22, 2017, the Board approved the Amended and Restated 2014 Plan (the "amended 2014 Plan"), subject to the approval of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amendment increases the maximum number of shares of our common stock that are authorized for issuance under the 2014 Plan from 22.5 million to 32.7 million, an increase of 10.2 million shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amended 2014 Plan also contains additional non-material changes not subject to shareholder approval, including a minimum vesting requirement of one year, dividend  restrictions on unvested awards, and a change to the tax withholding language to permit 2014 Plan participants to have shares withheld from their awards up to the maximum  withholding rate permitted under applicable law (in response to recent regulatory changes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board adopted the amended 2014 Plan on April 22, 2017, although the amendment to increase the maximum number of shares of common stock is subject to the approval our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are now asking you to approve the amended 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amended 2014 Plan will become effective upon the approval of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/00007644781700001 l/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee administers the amended 2014 Plan and has full power and authority to determine when and to whom awards will be granted, and the type, amount,  form of payment and other terms and conditions of each award, consistent with the provisions of the amended 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate the authority  to grant awards to one or more officer or director, subject to any terms, conditions or limitations the Compensation Committee may impose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee  may not delegate such authority with respect to awards granted to officers subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act or if such delegation would cause the amended 2014 Plan not to  comply with the requirements of Section 162(m) or applicable law or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee can specify whether, and under what circumstances,  awards to be received under the amended 2014 Plan may be deferred automatically or at the election of either the holder of the award or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Compensation Committee may amend or waive the terms and conditions, or accelerate the exercisability or the lapse of any restrictions relating to any outstanding award, subject to  the amended 2014 Plans minimum vesting requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has authority to interpret the amended 2014 Plan, and establish rules and regulations for the  administration of the amended 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board may exercise the powers of the Compensation Committee at any time, except with respect to the grant of awards to  our executive officers.

sentences.text: The aggregate number of shares of common stock that may be issued under the amended 2014 Plan is 32.7 million (representing 22.5 million, the original number of shares  approved by shareholders in 2014, plus the 10.2 million shares requested for approval in this proxy statement).

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may adjust the number of shares and share limits described above in the case of a stock dividend or other distribution, including a stock  split, merger or other similar corporate transaction or event, in order to prevent dilution or enlargement of the benefits or potential benefits intended to be provided under  the amended 2014 Plan.

sentences.text: Performance Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards granted under the amended 2014 Plan are intended to qualify as "performance-based compensation" within the meaning of Section  162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards give participants the right to receive payments in cash, stock or property based solely upon the achievement of certain performance goals during a  specified performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee must designate all participants for each performance period, and establish performance goals and target awards for  each participant no later than 90 days after the beginning of each performance period within the parameters of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance goals must be based solely on one or  more business criteria as set forth in the amended 2014 Plan.

sentences.text: For the past several years, the Compensation Committee has based performance goals on total shareholder return  (TSR).

sentences.text: For fiscal 2018, the Committee added an additional performance goal based on revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information about the performance goals and business criteria applied to our  performance awards can be found within the C o m p e n s a tio n  D is c u s s io n  a n d  A n a ly s is section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant of Options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of a stock option or SAR is not expected to result in any taxable income for the recipient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exercise of Options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon exercising a non-qualified stock option, the optionee must recognize ordinary income equal to the excess of the fair market value of the shares  of our common stock acquired on the date of exercise over the exercise price, and we will generally be entitled at that time to an income tax deduction for the same amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  holder of an incentive stock option generally will have no taxable income upon exercising the option (except that an alternative minimum tax liability may arise), and we will not be  entitled to an income tax deduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon exercising a SAR, the amount of any cash received and the fair market value on the exercise date of any shares of our common stock  received are taxable to the recipient as ordinary income and generally deductible by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disposition of Shares Acquired Upon Exercise of Options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax consequence upon a disposition of shares acquired through the exercise of an option or SAR will  depend on how long the shares have been held and whether the shares were acquired by exercising an incentive stock option or by exercising a non-qualified stock option or SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, there will be no tax consequence to us in connection with the disposition of shares acquired under an option or SAR, except that we may be entitled to an income tax  deduction in the case of the disposition of shares acquired under an incentive stock option before the applicable incentive stock option holding periods set forth in the Internal  Revenue Code have been satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock and Unrestricted Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recipients of grants of restricted stock generally will be required to include as taxable ordinary income the fair market value of the  restricted stock at the time it is no longer subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, unrestricted stock grants are taxable at grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An award holder who makes an 83(b)  election within 30 days of the date of grant of the restricted stock will incur taxable ordinary income on the date of grant equal to the fair market value of such shares of restricted  stock (determined without regard to forfeiture restrictions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the sale of shares after the forfeiture restrictions have expired, the holding period to determine whether  the award recipient has long-term or short-term capital gain (or loss) generally begins when the restrictions expire, and the tax basis for such shares will generally be based on the  fair market value of the shares on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the award holder made an 83(b) election as described above, the holding period commences on the date of such election, and  the tax basis will be equal to the fair market value of the shares on the date of the election (determined without regard to the forfeiture restrictions on the shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends, if any,  that are paid or accrued while the restricted stock is subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture are also taxed as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are entitled to an income tax deduction equal to  amounts the award holder includes in ordinary income at the time of such income inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards and Dividend Equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recipients of grants of restricted stock units, performance awards or dividend equivalents (collectively,  deferred awards) do not incur any federal income tax liability at the time the awards are granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award holders recognize ordinary income equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the amount of cash  received under the terms of the award or, as applicable,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the fair market value of the shares received (determined as of the date of receipt) under the terms of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend  equivalents received with respect to any deferred award are also taxed as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash or shares to be received pursuant to a deferred award generally become payable  when applicable forfeiture restrictions lapse; provided, however, that, if the terms of the award so provide, payment may be delayed until a later date to the extent permitted under  applicable tax laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are entitled to an income tax deduction for any amounts included by the award holder as ordinary income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards that are payable in shares, a  participants tax basis is equal to the fair market value of the shares at the time the shares become payable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the sale of the shares, appreciation (or depreciation) after the shares are paid is treated as either short-term or long-term capital gain (or loss) depending on how long the shares have been held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income Tax Deduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the usual rules concerning reasonable compensation, and assuming that, as expected, performance awards paid under the amended 2014 Plan are   qualified performance-based compensation within the meaning of Section 162(m), we are generally entitled to a corresponding income tax deduction at the time a participant  recognizes ordinary income from awards made under the amended 2014 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Application of Section 16.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special rules may apply to individuals subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, unless a special election is made pursuant to the Internal  Revenue Code, shares received through the exercise of a stock option or SAR may be treated as restricted as to transferability and subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture for a  period of up to six months after the date of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the amount of any ordinary income recognized and the amount of our income tax deduction is determined as of  the end of that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AMENDED & RESTATED  14 OMNIBUS INCENTIVE PL

sentences.text: 2014 OMNIBUS INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Plan is to promote the interests of the Company and its shareholders by aiding the Company in attracting and retaining employees, officers,  consultants, advisors and non-employee Directors capable of assuring the future success of the Company, to offer such persons incentives to put forth maximum efforts for the  success of the Companys business and to compensate such persons through various stock and cash-based arrangements and provide them with opportunities for stock ownership in  the Company, thereby aligning the interests of such persons with the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each such Performance Goal may be based
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) solely by reference to absolute results of individual performance or organizational performance at various levels (e.g., the  Companys performance or the performance of a subsidiary, division, business segment or business unit of the Company) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) upon organizational performance relative to the  comparable performance of other companies selected by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent consistent with Section 162(m), the Committee may, when it establishes performance  criteria, also provide for the exclusion of charges related to an event or occurrence which the Committee determines should appropriately be excluded, including (X) asset-write  downs, litigation or claim judgments or settlements, reorganizations, the impact of acquisitions and divestitures, restructurings, discontinued operations, extraordinary items, and  other unusual or non-recurring charges, (Y) foreign exchange gains and losses or an event either not directly related to the operations of the Company or not within the reasonable  control of the Companys management, or (Z) the cumulative effects of tax or accounting changes in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (or other  accounting principles which may then be in effect).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that Section 162(m) of the Code or applicable tax and/or securities laws change to permit Committee discretion to  alter the governing performance measures without disclosing to shareholders and obtaining shareholder approval of such changes and without thereby exposing the Company to  potentially adverse tax or other legal consequences, the Committee shall have the sole discretion to make such changes without obtaining shareholder approval.

sentences.text: Section 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/0000764478/000076447817000011/bbydefinitiveproxy2017.htm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
